definition: lit. heroes usually agree (idiom); Great minds think alike.
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 suo3 jian4 lu:e4 tong2

definition: United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]
hero/outstanding/excellent/(literary) flower/blossom
male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
plan/strategy/outline/summary/slightly/rather/to rob/to plunder/to summarize/to omit
like/same/similar/together/alike/with

sentences.english: Great minds think alike, but fools seldom differ.
sentences.chinese: 英雄所見略同，傻瓜很少意見不合。

sentences.english: Who says great minds think alike?
You agree with me. Great minds think alike.
sentences.chinese: 你同意我的看法，英雄所見略同啊。

sentences.english: Great minds think alike, that's just what I'm going to say.
sentences.chinese: 例句英雄所見略同，這正是我所要說的。

sentences.english: Yang and Lee "see eye to eye". They always have similar ideas.
sentences.chinese: 揚和李對撇子啊，總是英雄所見略同。

definition: lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: declarative sentence
see 領盒飯|领盒饭[ling3 he2 fan4]
grand dreams/unrealistic ideas (idiom)
henpecked male
partner for dating/a date (boyfriend or girlfriend)
to agree on three laws (idiom)/three-point covenant/(fig.) preliminary agreement/basic rules
Every family goes through its problems. (idiom)
pinyin: jia1 jia1 you3 ben3 nan2 nian4 de5 jing1

definition: all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: shouting abuse in the street like a fishwife
to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability

laser pointer
